Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Offre d'emploi : Data Analyst - Suivi de Production

Experis SA recherche pour un de ses clients, acteur de premier plan dans son domaine, un(e) Data Analyst spécialisé(e) en suivi de production pour rejoindre une équipe dynamique et motivée, dans un environnement technologique stimulant. Vous souhaitez évoluer dans un cadre exigeant où les solutions que vous proposez ont un impact direct sur les opérations de production ? Ce poste est fait pour vous !



Vos Responsabilités



En tant que Data Analyst, vous interviendrez dans le suivi quotidien des activités de production, avec un large éventail de responsabilités, notamment :

Gestion de l'obsolescence : Assurer le suivi et l'anticipation des mises à jour et fins de vie des systèmes.
Suivi des Backups : Contrôler et garantir la fiabilité des sauvegardes.
Coordination avec les équipes techniques : Collaborer pour résoudre efficacement les problèmes signalés dans les dashboards.
Proposition d'améliorations continues pour optimiser les suivis et les processus.
Suivi des licences software : Gérer les licences en coordination avec l'équipe Software Asset Management (SAM) basée en Pologne, en fournissant des rapports précis issus des inventaires (ADDM, BigFix, etc.).
Support aux managers : Apporter des conseils et recommandations aux managers sur les sujets liés à la production et à la sécurité.

Ce rôle s'étend à des missions de sécurité en cas de vulnérabilité détectée, nécessitant une réactivité et une capacité d'adaptation pour anticiper les éventuels besoins futurs.



Profil Recherché



Pour réussir dans ce poste, voici les compétences et qualités essentielles :

Expérience significative en production informatique : 6 ans minimum.
Compétences techniques : Maîtrise des infrastructures techniques et des outils bureautiques, Excel en particulier.
Compétences analytiques : Vous êtes capable de gérer des priorités, analyser des données et proposer des plans d'action concrets.
Qualités relationnelles : Excellente communication en français et anglais, sens de l'organisation, rigueur et autonomie.
Esprit d'équipe et adaptation : Capacité à travailler en équipe, partager l'information, et s'adapter rapidement aux besoins changeants.
Culture orientée données : Vous êtes à l'aise avec l'évolution technologique et intéressé(e) par les nouvelles technologies telles que l'intelligence artificielle (un plus apprécié).


Pourquoi Nous Rejoindre ?



Chez Experis SA, nous nous engageons à accompagner votre carrière et à trouver des postes alignés avec vos aspirations. Même si votre profil ne correspond pas totalement aux critères, n'hésitez pas à me contacter directement sur LinkedIn ou par e-mail. Il me fera plaisir de vous aider dans votre recherche du meilleur poste pour vous et de vous accompagner tout au long de votre parcours. Votre épanouissement professionnel est notre priorité, et nous serons ravis de discuter de votre profil et de vos ambitions.

Postulez maintenant et rejoignez une équipe où votre expertise et votre potentiel font la différence.

#DataAnalyst #ProductionSupport #GestionDeLicences #InfrastructuresIT #OpportunitéDeCarrière #ExperisSA

Title: Junior Payroll Data Analyst
Description:
Mercuria is one of the world’s leading independent energy and commodity groups. Our purpose is to connect markets and to advance the energy transition. We bring markets together to support the world’s energy needs of today by trading, structuring finance, and investing into strategic assets, whilst generating over $170 billion in turnover. We are committed to advancing the transition to a more sustainable, affordable and reliable energy system for tomorrow. We are well ahead of the pledge we made in 2021 that over half of our investment capital will go into sectors that are advancing the energy transition by 2025, to contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.




As a Junior Payroll Analyst for Mercuria Energy Trading, your primary role will be to assist in the collection, preparation, and provision of payroll information to our payroll team; focusing on finding ways to automate and optimize the process. You will work to ensure accuracy and confidentiality in all payroll data, while also providing exceptional payroll services and support. Your advanced analytics and data science skills will be relevant to enhance our processes and act as an agent of change.




Key Responsibilities:




Assist the payroll team with the timely collection and preparation of payroll variables on a monthly basis.
Verify the accuracy of payroll information by collecting, computing, and entering data into the payroll system.
Assist in preparing payroll reports for audits and management review.
Update payroll records by entering changes in exemptions, insurance coverage, deductions, job titles, and department/division transfers.
Respond to payroll queries by providing required information timely and accurately, while maintaining the confidentiality of payroll operations.
Liaise with human resources for new hires, terminations, and benefits updates.
Participate in relevant projects that require cross-departmental collaboration when required.
Utilize advanced analytics and numeric skills to improve payroll processes.
Apply business analysis capabilities to identify and implement process automation.
Engage in data science and coding tasks to support payroll and broader business functions.







Qualifications and Skills:




Bachelor’s Degree in a numerical field of studies;
Minimum 2 years of experience in a function where you are responsible for collecting variables, reconciling and analyzing data.
Strong numerical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel, with advanced analytics skills.
Proficiency in French and English. Additional language skills would be a plus.
Tech-savvy with a strong interest in data science and coding.
Strong drive for process enhancements and automation.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist (m/w/x)
Description:
Wir entwickeln die besten Shopping Companions!

Die Bring! Labs AG vereinfacht den Einkauf für Millionen von Menschen auf der ganzen Welt. Als etabliertes und schnell wachsendes Schweizer Softwareunternehmen mit Standorten in Zürich, Berlin und Basel bieten wir Unternehmen aus dem Handel und der Konsumgüterbranche die effizienteste Mobile Advertising Plattform, um ihre Produkte zu bewerben. Unsere Produkte, die beliebten Apps "Bring!" und "Profital", verzeichnen ein starkes Wachstum und wir verfolgen ambitionierte Ziele für die Zukunft.

Mit unserer einzigartigen Mobile Advertising Plattform erreichen wir Konsument:innen zum Zeitpunkt der Kaufentscheidung und sind damit hoch relevant für den modernen Media-Mix unserer Werbekund:innen aus dem Konsumgüterbereich und dem Einzelhandel.

Über die Rolle

Als unser Business Intelligence Specialist (m/w/d) nutzt du Datenanalysen, um unsere Sales-Teams dabei zu unterstützen, Kund:innen zu gewinnen und langfristig zu binden Gleichzeitig hilfst du unserem Marketing-Team mit datenbasierten Erkenntnissen B2B- und B2C-Geschichten zu entwickeln. Durch gezielte, datengetriebene Analysen und Erkenntnisse erkennst du Chancen, optimierst Sales- und Content-Marketing-Strategien und trägst so entscheidend zur Steigerung der Kundenbindung und zum Unternehmenswachstum bei.

Deine Aufgaben:


Du analysierst grosse Datensätze, um bedeutungsvolle Erkenntnisse und Trends zu extrahieren, die unsere Sales-Teams unterstützen
Du arbeitest proaktiv mit Stakeholdern im gesamten Unternehmen zusammen, einschliesslich Sales, Marketing und Ad Operations, um deren Datenanforderungen zu verstehen und umsetzbare Erkenntnisse bereitzustellen
Du entwirfst, entwickelst und pflegst benutzerdefinierte Berichte, Analysen und Dashboards, die unsere Daten anschaulich visualisieren. Dabei entdeckst du einzigartige Erkenntnisse, die unsere Werbewirkung demonstrieren und helfen, unsere Kund:innen zu überzeugen
Du übersetzt Geschäftsanforderungen in technische Spezifikationen für Datenberichte und Analysen



Requirements


Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer BI-Rolle
Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL, Datenanalytik und ETL-Prozessen
Expertise in BI-Tools wie AWS Quicksight, Adverity oder ähnlichen Plattformen
Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R zur Datenanalyse und Automatisierung
Fähigkeit, komplexe Datensätze mithilfe statistischer Techniken zu analysieren, Trends und Korrelationen zu identifizieren
Kompetenz in der Übersetzung komplexer Ergebnisse in klare visuelle Formate mithilfe von Datenvisualisierungstools
Ausgeprägte Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und ein Auge für Details
Hohe Eigeninitiative basierend auf einem tiefen Verständnis unserer Werbekund:innen, um nützliche Erkenntnisse und KPIs zu identifizieren und diese auf verständliche Weise zubereiten
Tiefes Verständnis von Geschäftsprozessen, insbesondere in der Ad-Tech-Branche, Kenntnisse der Einzelhandels- oder FMCG-Industrie von Vorteil
Ausgezeichnete schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, um komplexe Daten klar und prägnant zu präsentieren
Starke zwischenmenschliche Fähigkeiten zur Zusammenarbeit mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams und zum Management von Stakeholder-Beziehungen
Proaktive, flexible Arbeitsweise mit starkem Fokus auf die Bereitstellung umsetzbarer Ergebnisse
Fliessende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Benefits

Bei Bring! Labs legen wir Wert auf eine professionelle und offene Arbeitskultur, in der unterschiedliche Perspektiven und Hintergründe willkommen sind. Wir bieten dir einen grossartigen Arbeitsplatz, an dem du direkten Impact haben und deine Karriere weiterentwickeln kannst. Weiter bieten wir:


Ein junges und sich schnell entwickelndes Unternehmen, das Mitarbeitenden die Möglichkeit gibt, Entscheidungen zu treffen und unseren Erfolg mitzugestalten
Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit der Möglichkeit, sowohl in unseren Büros in Zürich oder Basel als auch teilweise im Homeoffice zu arbeiten
Regelmässige Team- und Company Events sowie ein Umfeld, das den Teamspirit aktiv fördert
Wir reisen umweltfreundlich und stellen wir dir dafür ein Halbtax für den ÖV zur Verfügung
Viele coole Perks wie ein freier Tag an deinem Geburtstag, toller Barista-Qualitätskaffee, neueste Hardware, Zuschüsse für dein Homeoffice und vieles mehr..


Wir berücksichtigen Bewerbungen unabhängig von Nationalität, ethnischem Hintergrund, Alter, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlecht, Behinderung oder familiärer Situation. Wir fördern auch die Bewerbungen von Berufsrückkehrern.

Willst du mehr wissen? Besuch unsere Karriereseite!

Title: Procurement Data Analyst 100% (m/f/d)
HTML:
About Us

MEOGROUP Switzerland supports its clients by leveraging a network of 12 specialized brands (Consulting & Services, Outsourced Service Center, Transition Management, Recruitment & Training) to provide comprehensive service coverage across the Procurement, Supply Chain, Finance/Controlling, and Project Management domains.


We operate in industries such as manufacturing, technology, banking and insurance, public services, commerce & distribution, global organizations, and NGOs, catering to both large corporations and mid-sized enterprises, irrespective of their market, transformation needs, or maturity level.


With a strong commitment to service and a genuine entrepreneurial culture, we harness numerous synergies and complementarities. Being at the heart of ecosystems and networks related to our markets and professions is crucial for us. We take pride in surrounding ourselves with strong partners in Switzerland, with whom we carefully collaborate and share on a daily basis.


We are looking for a Procurement Data Analyst to join our client's team. This position plays a key role in driving the company's digital transformation, with a focus on transitioning to a new ERP system and improving procurement workflows.


Your Responsibilities

  • Oversee system integration and user acceptance testing for Source-to-Pay configurations, addressing and escalating issues as necessary;
  • Contribute to creating change management strategies and training materials;
  • Assist the Source-to-Pay lead with decision-making and reporting tasks;
  • Generate precise reports on digitalization and procurement activities;
  • Collaborate with various teams, including medical and support functions;
  • Monitor supplier price trends, reconcile invoiced amounts with orders, and assess the impact of price fluctuations on project budgets;
  • Support accounts payable processes by ensuring accurate invoice entry and fostering supplier relationships;
  • Address non-compliance issues related to supplier invoices and resolve discrepancies promptly.


About You

  • Mini 3 years of proven experience in a similar role;
  • Experienced Data Analyst or Procurement Specialist with strong IT proficiency;
  • Strong background in BI, digital solutions, and finance or supplier accounting;
  • Experience in supplier accounting, reconciling invoices, and conducting financial analysis;
  • Competent in Coupa, Dynamics 365, PowerBI, etc;
  • Result-oriented mindset and excellent reporting skills;
  • Fluent in French and English (C1 minimum), German is a plus.


We will be transparent and provide support throughout the recruitment process. We look forward to learning more about you! #Wearemeogroup #Meogroupswitzerland


All our offers are inclusive.

Title: Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
The L’OCCITANE Group is a leading international manufacturer and retailer of premium and sustainable beauty and wellness products. The Group operates in 90 countries worldwide and has 3,000 retail outlets, including over 1,300 of its own stores. Within its portfolio of premium beauty brands that champion organic and natural ingredients are: L’OCCITANE en Provence, Melvita, Erborian, L’OCCITANE au Brésil, LimeLife by Alcone, ELEMIS, Sol de Janeiro and Dr. Vranjes Firenze.

With its nature-positive vision and entrepreneurial ethos, L’OCCITANE Group is committed to investing in communities, biodiversity, reducing waste and to finding sustainable solutions to create a better and healthier planet. The mission statement of the Group is: With empowerment we positively impact people and regenerate nature.

L’OCCITANE is also committed to sustainability for business, people & the planet, as well as respect of human rights, ethics principles and labour protection. All employees at L’OCCITANE must therefore implement the company’s mission and integrate the social, environmental, economic and legal effects of their actions in their day-to-day job. In practice, this means that any employee at L’OCCITANE shall contribute to growing sales, regenerating nature, caring for our consumers & partners and supporting our employees. The L'OCCITANE Group is a certified B CorporationTM.

Contexte & Mission

Intégré(e) au sein de l’équipe Analytics, tu mèneras à bien des projets BI depuis le recueil du besoin jusqu’à la construction des dashboards, en passant par la modélisation du flux de données ainsi que les phases de tests nécessaires. Tu seras également impliqué(e) dans les projets de migration de nos outils de transformation de données vers DBT. Les périmètres fonctionnels abordés seront variés et incluront entre autres : la connaissance client, l’analyse de nos performances sur les différentes canaux de ventes (boutiques, e-commerce, marketplace,…) et bien d’autres. Cette variété sera d’autant plus renforcée par notre contexte international, chaque région ayant ses spécificités et besoins.

Principales Missions


Participation à la migration de nos outils Data (Talend/BODS vers DBT),
Pilotage de projets data :
Recueil du besoin (conduire des ateliers avec les équipes)
Développement de la solution
Recette
Support

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Über uns:

Für ein führendes Unternehmen in der Finanzbranche mit Sitz in Basel suchen wir Verstärkung. In dieser Festanstellung arbeiten Sie in einem dynamischen, kleinen Team, das sich darauf spezialisiert hat, wertvolle Einblicke aus der umfangreichen Datenwelt der Bank zu gewinnen. Unser Team verantwortet den gesamten Prozess von der Datenbeschaffung bis zur Auswertung, wobei innovative Lösungen und der Einsatz moderner Technologien wie Künstlicher Intelligenz eine wichtige Rolle spielen.







Ihre Aufgaben:

Erfassung und Dokumentation von Aufträgen sowie Erstellung technischer Anforderungen in Abstimmung mit dem Auftraggeber.
Import und Analyse von Daten aus Quellsystemen.
Entwicklung und Pflege von Prozeduren im Data Warehouse zur Berechnung relevanter KPIs und zur Erstellung aussagekräftiger Berichte.
Erstellung von Dashboards und Dokumentation der Entwicklungen.
Automatisierung von wiederkehrenden Aufgaben, Berichten und Prozessen.
Sicherstellung der Datenqualität und -integrität für alle Produkte.
Mitarbeit an Konzepten für neue Produkte und Entwicklung von KI-Modellen bzw. Einsatz von KI-Tools.




Ihr Profil:

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung oder Studium in Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik.
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Warehouse/BI bei einem Finanzdienstleister.
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Excel und relationalen Datenbanken, vorzugsweise MS SQL Server oder Oracle.
Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in T-SQL.
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit BI-Tools wie QlikSense oder PowerBI; Kenntnisse in Jedox und der Bankenplattform Avaloq sind von Vorteil.
Erfahrungen mit Python und Data-Science-Aufgaben sind ebenfalls von Vorteil für zukünftige Projekte.
Analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen, hohe Eigeninitiative und eine lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise.
Hoher Qualitätsanspruch, Lernbereitschaft und Verantwortungsbewusstsein.
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse und gute Französischkenntnisse (oder umgekehrt).




Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung und darauf, Sie vielleicht schon bald in unserem Team willkommen zu heissen!

Title: Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

Activités

Job Dimension:

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:


Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat


Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Power quantitative analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies is targeting to build a portfolio of 100 GW of renewables by 2030 and to become one of the main player in renewables worldwide. This will be achieved through many investment projects (2-4 b$/year). Trading Power will contribute to this ambition by managing financial and physical power and risks of the renewables portfolio on open markets. TEM (Trading Energy Management) performance team aims at supporting TEM in creating a profitable and sustainable portfolio by providing analyses of the profitability and risks of its different businesses (PPA portfolio, short term optimisation, etc…).

As Power Quantitative Analyst, you will develop models to support risk analyses, fundamental modelling, hedging strategies and investment decisions and make recommendation to Structured Portfolio traders and senior management. This will require dealing with complex technical and theoretical problems requiring quantitative approaches.

Activités

What you will do:

As a Power Quantitative Analyst your main responsibilities will be the following:


Specify, design & implement mathematical models to handle pricing issues & risk assessment of a portfolio of renewables assets and backtest & optimise models performance.
Run regular risk analysis of the portfolio, analyse hedging strategies and portfolio effect, and make recommendation to traders and senior management.
Work closely with structured portfolio and short term traders to support them in specific risk & pricing analysis
Manage IT-related questions (deployment, QA) directly with IT and Trading Systems team (Python / AWS / TFS) and support Trading support function (MO, operations …) with the takeover of tools developed by the team
Develop and maintain an understanding of Trading Power desks businesses and stay up to date regarding their positions and products.

Detailed knowledge of alumina and aluminium markets, both inside and outside of China

Title: Lead Data Analyst (Circular Programs & Innovation)
Description:
In short

We are looking for an innovative and data-focused leader to drive the program objectives, measurement strategy, and analytics efforts for primarily Cyclon, our overarching circularity program. You will play a critical part in defining the success metrics, improving data quality, reporting, and providing insights that influence strategic decisions around the program. This role will also expand its scope to further innovation and omnichannel-driven business ventures using a strong and agile ability to understand and implement insights from various sources, assess project feasibility, evaluate market opportunity and understand consumer perception. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sustainability and circular business models, coupled with expertise in data analysis and a strong growth-centric mindset.




Your mission

Collaborate with teams across e.g. Strategy, Innovation and Commercial to define clear Cyclon business objectives alongside the program execution and scaleup. Identify key improvement areas and act as the point of contact for measurement, data analytics, and research.
Lead efforts in defining and implementing customer journey tracking mechanisms that capture interactions and touchpoints across the entire Cyclon program lifecycle. Provide insights into customer feedback and engagement to optimize touchpoints and improve overall experience.
Work closely with the Cyclon core team to ensure the integrity of data collection and analysis around operational and customer experience (CX) metrics and derive insights that help drive the direction of the program. Assess the impact of our efforts and use internal and external insights (e.g. market data) to make suggestions on further growth opportunities.
Take ownership of assessing our existing Cyclon data landscape, then build and execute on blueprints for the future of our program reporting especially as it relates across sales channels. Develop and implement strategies to improve data quality, ensuring high-quality, actionable insights.
Define key KPIs and measures of success as well as establish the source of truth for performance reporting. Establish benchmarks and assess the commercial viability of both the existing program and new initiatives, and present data-driven insights to senior stakeholders to guide program evolution. Own standardized (e.g. monthly) reporting on the program and establish reporting frameworks for new programs.




Your story

You have 5+ years of experience as Data or Business Analyst in a Retail/Commercial/Consulting business, with experience in sustainable/circular programs a major plus.
You come with a clear understanding of the Commercial landscape including Ecommerce, merchandising, customer, product and brand KPIs.
You have experience translating strategy into action, building business cases and assessing feasibility of new business ventures using data and insights gathered from a variety of sources.
You are proficient in using query languages such as SQL, and have experience working with complex datasets. Experience with other analytical languages such as Python or R are considered a plus.
You are a strong communicator and cross-functional collaborator, with the ability to take workstream ownership, partner with different functions, and effectively move projects and topics forward.
You have experience with data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau, to provide insightful dashboards and visualizations.
You have a very strong analytical and quantitative mindset with a demonstrated ability to interpret and leverage data to drive decision making.




What We Offer

On is a place that is centered around growth and progress. We offer an environment designed to give people the tools to develop holistically – to stay active, to learn, explore and innovate. Our distinctive approach combines a supportive, team-oriented atmosphere, with access to personal self-care for both physical and mental well-being, so each person is led by purpose.

On is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a work environment that is fair and inclusive, where all decisions related to recruitment, advancement, and retention are free of discrimination.
